intro: Elatostema agusanense, commonly known as the Agusan elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Agusan province. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces tiny greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Elatostema agusanense is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories, where it thrives in the humid tropical climate.
